item.title: Complex Conjugate
item.description: Definition The Complex Conjugate of a complex number \(Z=x+iy\) is given by: \[\overline{Z}=\overline{x+iy}=x-iy\] This operation flips the sign of the imaginary part Properties When multiplied by the original, the result is always a real number \[Z \cdot \overline{Z} = (x+iy)*x-iy) = x^2 + y^2\] Applications Rationalise complex fractions - Operations on Complex Numbers Find the modulus of a complex number
